alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 4:41PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern West Feliciana, West Baton Rouge, southeastern Pointe Coupee, East Feliciana and East Baton Rouge Parishes through 530 PM CDT... At 441 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Zachary, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Denham Springs, Port Allen, New Roads, Jackson, St. Francisville, Clinton, Oak Hills Place, Livonia, Maringouin, Slaughter, Wilson, Wakefield, Westminster, Spillman, Erwinville, Pride and Shenandoah. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 142 and 164. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana
